content:
Sadness in relationship to imagination is caused by the belief that an imagined object will no longer be able to be love or provide value to you.

In this context it is probably created by your self-image (it is subjective, so you have to tell me) because you have an aversion or dislike of the concept of death or the imagined puppy was perceived as something that could act compassionately towards you but it then died, preventing it from doing so. If you imagined a worm or virus you likely would have no emotional relationship.

You are sad imagining a dead puppy because you think death is bad and something you are worried about happening to you or anything you care about, and/or the puppy you imagined had positive characteristics that made you feel better about yourself, and so its absence caused you to feel you have lost something that you can't get back. 

You can replace the idea of "I imagined a fake dead puppy, I am sad" with "I imagined my crush rejects me and dates someone else. I am sad". You are upset because you are imagining something that you think makes your life worse. It is exactly the same thing. Both are equally non existent, the emotional relationship to our imagination of the event is an error and is what self-image is.
